history.content:
I guess first you should know that data 100 does not require any mathematical maturity. You won't be writing proofs or anything like that. You will learn some probability but it is not very advanced compared to other stats classes. It also doesn't use very much linear algebra, and they reteach what everyone forgot. You do need to be able to memorize some pandas stuff. 

I personally think that if you take cs61bl with another class you will regret it. 61bl has a midterm or a project due pretty much every week and a lab due every day. It is a black hole of time.

Stat 140 is also a black hole of time from what I have heard. Like very rewarding but also very time consuming. If you do 61bl in the summer then data 100 should be pretty chill because most people spend most of their time on the coding for homeworks and labs. So stat 140 and data 100 would be an ok combo since you'd be able to spend most time on stat 140. The bummer is that it also requires math 54/stat 89a as a corequisite. But there apparently is not that much Lin alg and you could probably just learn it as the class goes along. Or you could just take math 54 in the fall since 61b will make data 100 a lot easier. Also stat 140 will cover the data 100 probability pretty fast and rigorously so like everything you would learn in data 100 you would already know from other classes. So that would be good

Hi, I am a transfer rising senior and have only taken 1A, 1B, CS 88 and Data 8 at Cal. I was advised by many to take one or two courses in summer from the list of CS 61BL, Math 54 and DS 100.

Option 1) A Stat Professor advised me to take Data 100 and Math 54 in summer, and CS 61B and Stat 140 in Fall.

Option 2) Several TAs of mine advised me to take only CS 61BL in summer because otherwise, it would be difficult to handle both courses. Then I would be taking DS 100, Stat 140 and Math 54 in Fall.

Option 3) The last suggestion I've received is to take CS 61BL AND Math 54 in the summer to develop mathematical maturity so that I would be able to have skills necessary for DS100 and Stat 140 in my fall semester.

What would the workload of them be like in the summer? Would you recommend any of these optional schedules?

I would really appreciate any suggestions and Thanks in advance!
history.subject: CS 61BL AND Math 54 in the summer?
